p: Extraction with Subcritical water (SW) is a mechanism mainly dependent on water as an extractant at relatively high pressure to maintain the liquid form and temperature ranging from 100 °C to 374 °C [ 112]. SW facilitates fast extraction operation and utilizes low temperatures, which prevent losses of volatiles as well as the degradation of compounds [ 124]. The SW technique includes a transmission of solutes from the sample to the extraction medium utilizing convection, diffusion and partitioning equilibrium [ 125]. Water offers unrivalled characteristics under subcritical conditions. Eco-friendly, affordable and rapid extraction rate are the main advantages of this process [ 126]. Many reports have investigated the use of water as a solvent for several components including lignocelluloses [ 127]. Moreover, it has been used in carbonization, liquefaction and gasification processes [ 128].
